comments:
Another one that I get rather often, usually when doing a "Declaration => Workspace" (Ctrl-G) or "Reference => Workspace" (Ctrl-Shift-G).

Eclipse 3.2M3
AJDT 1.5.0M5

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-12-01 15:49:14.208
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Java Search".
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.Assert$AssertionFailedException: Assertion failed; The source type has an invalid name: RuleStatisticsAspect.aj
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:89)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.SourceType.<init>(SourceType.java:43)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.CompilationUnit.getType(CompilationUnit.java:796)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.matching.PossibleMatch.getQualifiedName(PossibleMatch.java:103)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.matching.PossibleMatch.<init>(PossibleMatch.java:41)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.matching.MatchLocator.locateMatches(MatchLocator.java:1111)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.JavaSearchParticipant.locateMatches(JavaSearchParticipant.java:94)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.BasicSearchEngine.findMatches(BasicSearchEngine.java:208)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.BasicSearchEngine.search(BasicSearchEngine.java:464)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.core.search.SearchEngine.search(SearchEngine.java:532)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.search.JavaSearchQuery.run(JavaSearchQuery.java:134)
	at org.eclipse.search2.internal.ui.InternalSearchUI$InternalSearchJob.run(InternalSearchUI.java:94)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)
over the wall to AJDT - might be something you already have Matt :)
Eclipse 3.2M5 added support for compilation units with non-.java extensions, so this error should no longer occur.
